questions.question: 1. Which of the following is true in the KMP string searching algorithm? (strInd = iterator in the main string)

answers.a: The value of strInd always increases in all iterations.
answers.b: The value of strInd remains the same in all iterations.
answers.c: The value of strInd may or may not increase in all iterations, but it never decreases.

explanations.a: Incorrect. strInd can remain the same during a mismatch.
explanations.b: Incorrect. strInd does not always remain the same; it advances when characters match.
explanations.c: Correct. strInd may stay the same during a mismatch, but it never decreases in the KMP algorithm.

questions.question: 2. How does KMP improve the brute-force method?

answers.a: By comparing the characters right to left instead of left to right.
answers.b: By searching for text in the pattern instead of the pattern in the string.
answers.c: By avoiding redundant comparisons and using information from previous matches.

explanations.a: Incorrect. KMP compares left to right, not right to left.
explanations.b: Incorrect. KMP searches for the pattern in the string, not the other way around.
explanations.c: Correct. KMP uses the LPS array to avoid redundant comparisons, making it more efficient than brute-force.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Only option c is correct.
